answers.answer: Good glad everything is going well for you, I have my 1 hour test this friday and not looking forward to it.  Keep us posted when you find out what you are having.
Good luck, I find out on the 7th.  I think I am having a boy too.  I will be surprised if I have a girl.

Glad to hear you're doing fine! I have to say I rather like the fruit punch.....So much better than that orange. That's all they had when I had my first three. The orange reminds me of a flat orange Sunkist. Let us know when you find out what you're having.

We were all asking if anyone had heard from you.  Good to know everything is fine and on schedule.  Yeah, I'm right with you on the glucose test.  I go for mine on the 21st.  I've never had gestational diabetes with any of my other pregnancies, but just a year and a half ago I lost my brother two weeks after her turned 31 from complications due to his diabetes and it does worry me a bit.  But all and all I know he's looking down on me and God has me (has us ALL) so I know everything will be fine!  Keep ya updated.

I also asked the doc if it's normal for me to be having braxton hicks at 19 weeks.  His response and I quote was "For you? Yes, it's normal" LOL I think he was referring to the fact that this will be my 5th full term pregnancy...but the way he said it was so funny.

Its good to hear from you. Glad things are going well. I know the feeling about chasing the baby around to find the heart beat. We had to do that yesterday too! Lol!!! We scheduled my Ultra sound for May 8th then we will hopefully get to find out what we are having too. Good luck to you!!! I also posted some pics from the ultrasound we did last week for the Downs Prescreening. The sonographer said our little one is very photogenic. Check em out. Everything is so clear.

Well, wonderful!!! I've heard Braxton Hicks can start as early as 5-6 weeks preggo??? They just aren't as noticeable or something.Anyway, congrats, congrats, congrats! Can't wait to hear what you're having!!! And just close your eyes and chug the Glucola!

LOL...I'm used to the orange stuff...not so sure about fruit punch, i'm not really big on fruit punch so it'll be interesting chugging 10 oz in 5 mins.  I'm just SOOO anxious to find out the sex.  I just know these last 4 weeks are going to go sooooo slow.  EVERYONE swears I'm having a boy...I don't have a feeling one way or the other so we'll see.

You are, you're having a boy! I will be SO surprised if you're not. To be honest, I won't know what to think, lol! I've never been through the gluclose test myself but I have tasted the stuff and watched my friends and family drink it many, many times. Is it normal for them to wait to give me the test until about 30 weeks? That's how far along I'll be. That's also the same day I should be getting my first round of RhoGAM.Hopefully it'll go by fast!
My daughter just had her glucose test at 27 weeks, and I think they like to do it between 26-30 weeks (something like that).
dunno...mine will be done ar 23 weeks...I guess it depends on the doc

question: Ok so I haven't posted in awhile, life's been kinda crazy.  Anyway, So I had my ob appt today.  Doc had to chase the baby a few minutes to get the heartbeat but we finally go it and it's in 140's.  I asked him about some sharp pains I've been having on my right side.  It's round ligament pain but not the normal stretching pain.  Mine is sharper becuase I've been pregnant so many times that my ligaments are more prone to tearing and that's where the sharp pains are coming from.  Doc scheduled my next appt along with my ultrasound.  It's set for April 9th at 9 am.  So, in 4 weeks from today I'll hpoefully be able to find out the sex.  EVERYONE I know is saying it's a boy, not a single person has told me they thought it was a girl.  SO I'm really hoping the next 4 weeks won't DRAG by.  I'll be doing my 1 hr glucose the next time.  10 oz of nasty fruit punc in 5 minutes (gross).
title: Update on my appt today.
